By  Tara SnowdenOctober  

Roommates They can make or break a students college experience PERIOD

Some students get lucky and find a best friend while others cannot wait until the weekend to be away from their roommates PERIOD

When a student applies for housing after being accepted to NIU the forms filled out are limited to lifestyle choices PERIOD

We ask new students what floor community they wish to live on said Michael Stang director of residential operations PERIOD We generally try to get them in the type of lifestyle they requested. for students from other state schools such as Illinois State University however the selection process allows for more choices and more freedom PERIOD

Students are able to search online for what hall and lifestyle they would like PERIOD They are then shown the floors and rooms in that residence hall that are available said Mindy Mangialardi associate director of the residential life at ISU PERIOD

ISU adopted this policy about five years ago for returning students and expanded the program to include freshman about three years ago PERIOD Mangialardi said she believes students feel the process gives them more control over life at ISU and helps them feel comfortable with the surroundings PERIOD

Its really nice for new students Mangialardi said PERIOD Students feel better when they have control over their room assignments. not just Northern 

Other state schools also adopted this policy of electronicallyselecting roommates PERIOD

Southern Illinois University Carbondale also makes a Roommate Quiz available PERIOD Students can sit down with their roommates to set boundaries right away PERIOD This allows students to not only get to know their roommate and their preferences but also allows them to solve any potential problems before the school year begins PERIOD

Stang said he thinks placing emphasis on the floor lifestyle is more important to student success than living with a roommate who shares the same interests PERIOD

It tends to work better this way in that while roommates are a critical part of the living environment living on a floor with people with similar academic or social interests makes the floor experience better as a whole Stang said PERIOD The people on your floor become somewhat of your family while you are here. nIU not looking for new policy

Surveys however may not always accurately represent the current views of the student PERIOD

Sometimes when students fill out those surveys they are partially through their senior year of high school and much of their responses are based on their current habits and the family environment Stang said PERIOD My sense is that when students go to college those things change because they are in a completely new environment. mangialardi admits having this online system has its downsides despite it being convenient for students and housing staff PERIOD

When we matched students by hand there were times when we knew more about halls than the new students did so if students couldnt get into a specific hall that they wished we sometimes knew of a hall that was exactly the same or almost the same and we could place them in that hall Mangialardi said PERIOD Whereas when students pick the halls themselves they dont always know that information. nIU administrators are not looking to adopt a new policy for placing roommates together because they have not found a procedure that works as well as the current one PERIOD Stang said although there are few students who do not get along with their roommates most students find they are pleased with the floor they are on and find it easy to get along with their roommates as well PERIOD

Most people come to college with the realization that they are going to live with someone they arent familiar with Stang said PERIOD They have to find a way to get around the differences which makes the living environment a great experience for students. advertisement
